result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael D Smith

records.addlTxt: Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order, signed and filed.

Defendant Michael D Smith in court, in custody.  Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court for Michael D Smith.  Attorney Alicia H Kort in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant not produced for today's court date.  Defendant's appearance is waived.

Defense has received discovery and an offer and request a final pretrial and jury trial. The defendant having issues viewing discovery in jail.  Counsel continue to discuss resolution with client. 

Motion to be filed by 10/7 after obtaining a court date from the clerk.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 30, 2023 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael D Smith in court with attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael D Smith in custody.  Alicia Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant is provided a copy of the information.  Defense counsel waived reading and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.  Discovery and offer received.  Court request an adjourned date to review discovery and offer with client.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael D Smith in court with Attorney Heather L. Johnson.  Defendant Michael D Smith in custody.  Alicia Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective P. Miner. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defense given a copy. Defense requests an arraignment date.  Case is adjourned to Branch 15.  Arraignment scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
s.s. 971.23(9) Notice Of Intent To Use DNA Evidence At Trial - received

Attorney Heather L. Johnson in court, appear by vidoe. Defendant Michael D Smith not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a prelimnary hearing. State witness present. Due to court congestion, Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion and Order for Withdrawal of Counsel, signed and filed.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel
Motion and prop. order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael D Smith not in court, defendant in custody.  Alicia Kort appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Heather Johnson is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with NCS (DOB 03/04/2008), Tiffany B.

Defendant Michael D Smith in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Michael D Smith in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Michael D Smith appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
